answers.answer: Stress, sleeplessness might be the reason behind this. But good to know that you are non diabetic and non hypertensive. With proper balanced diet, exercise and sleep with decreasing your stress i think you would solve your problem yourself. For oedema of legs you can keep your legs a little elevated. If you have varicose veins this can be treated easily. Take care!

question: Help!  My toes started to become numb 6 months ago while my husband was ill.  Now they are really numb.  The podiatrist says its a sign of diabetes.  Ive been tested 10 times lately and I'm not diabetic.  My brother is a type I and my mom was a type II diabetic, but all tests conclude that I am fine.  I am worried about the numbness as my doctor cant explain it. At times, my feet feel clumsy and this morning walking into work, I tripped and broke a toe.The doc did a blood pressure test on my ankles and says its not due to poor circulation (but I am getting vericose veins).  She ordered a EMG test, but I'm worried it's some weird thing.  Can anyone offer suggestions of what I should seek out medically?  I am also very fatigued and Vit. D deficient,  but my husband passed on last month due to GBM that has stressed me. physically and emotionally.  My feet are growing more numb by the day..  '
title: numb toes and feet
